titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I went to the barber, & had my hair cut &c: then I walked to Westminster, & called successively on Q.A.B. and the Ecclesiastical Commission with the object of finding out what might be the prospects of a loan for the Palatial drains.
As a result of my interview, I wrote a letter to M
Downing formally applying for a loan. As I was passing S. Margaret's, West
I met somebody whom I did not know, but whose face was not altogether unfamiliar.
He told me that Fred Ramsay had been killed in France
, so I called at the Church & found there M
Ramsay his mother, whom I consoled as best I could. The afternoon was spent at the Church House, where the Church & State C
sate under the conduct of the Dean of Westminster. I called on Miss Pearce.
